issue.title: [C++] Flatbuffers based serialization protocol for Expressions
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8214](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It might provide a more scalable solution for serialization.

cc `[~bkietz]` `[~fsaintjacques]`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17116250) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We will need to create a serialization scheme for general array expressions (for use with arrow/compute)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17116338) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
When someone takes this up it would be nice if there was a discussion on how this will be unified with gandiva protobuf expression representation

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17116339) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yes, I would definitely like to see that happen. Using Flatbuffers is desirable to avoid the need to link libprotobuf.a

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17448159) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Shouldn't this be closed in favour of the compute IR-related JIRAs?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17449665) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield):*
I think the IR model seems like the right way to go with this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8214?focusedCommentId=17450457) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Yes, superseded by the IR proposal.
